summary: This is an email chain from January 2020 regarding the preparation and service of subpoenas to multiple major airlines (United, Southwest, JetBlue, Delta, American, Alaska, and the Airline Reporting Corporation) for flight/travel records. The records are sought for specific individuals (identifiers redacted) for various date ranges, including from July 2019 to the present and historical periods in the 1990s. The correspondence is between FBI personnel and legal staff, coordinating the confirmation of confidentiality before service.

persons.name: Judy Gorham
persons.role: Delta Airlines Contact for Legal Process
persons.context: Listed as the contact name for serving subpoenas to Delta Airlines, Inc. via email or fax.

persons.name: Lisa Magdaleno
persons.role: American Airlines Contact for Legal Process
persons.context: Listed as the contact name for serving subpoenas to American Airlines, directed to Corporate Security.

persons.name: Allyson Hawkins
persons.context: Listed as the contact name for United Airlines Corporate Security for receiving subpoenas via email or fax.

events.title: Initial Subpoena Request
events.description: An FBI agent sends an email requesting subpoenas be prepared for multiple airlines to obtain "any and all domestic flights" for specific identifiers (names redacted) for date ranges including July 2019-present and 1994-1998.

events.title: Subpoenas Prepared for Service
events.description: A follow-up email confirms that subpoenas for seven airlines and the Airline Reporting Corporation are attached and ready to serve, pending confirmation of confidentiality from the recipients or their attorneys.

locations: 4333 Amon Carter Blvd. Ft. Worth, TX 76155
2701 Queens Plaza N., Suite 1 Long Island City, NY 11101
keyFacts: In January 2020, the FBI was actively subpoenaing flight records from at least seven major U.S. airlines and the Airline Reporting Corporation as part of an investigation.
The subpoenas sought records for specific individuals (identifiers redacted in the document) for domestic flights.
The date ranges requested were extensive, covering a recent period (July 2019 to January 2020) and historical periods from the mid-1990s (1994-1998, 1995-1996).
The correspondence shows careful procedural steps, including confirming confidentiality with airline attorneys or recipients before serving the subpoenas.
The document provides specific contact names and methods (email/fax) for serving legal process to the legal or security departments of each airline.
